result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler Jr in Court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in Court for Anthony Bernard Butler Jr.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have NOT reached a resolution in this matter. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Correction made to court record. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Anthony Bernard Butler Jr.  Attorney Eric Bashirian in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense motions to adjourn hearing to allow time for counsel to meet with counsel to meet with Defendant and review Discovery. Defense provided update regarding resolution posture. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in branch 45. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18,2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Plea Hearing. Defendant appeared Via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Due to COVID-19 Protocol, Defendant was not able to appear in person. Parties selected a new date. Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 3:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland. Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in custody. Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the court of possible resolution and is requesting date for Plea hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in Court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in custody.  Eric Bashirian appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense Motion to Modify Bail. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in Court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Defendant appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Court advised the Defendant that Defense counsel is not available for today's hearing. Case adjourned for Bail/Bond hearing, Branch 46. Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Information provided to Victim/Witness Advocate.

Defense contacted the Court and State via email regarding bail hearing. Defense is not available May 18, 2022 at 1:30pm b/c he will be in OCCR.

NEW DATE: Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Information provided to MCSO and Victim/Witness Advocates.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Fitzgerald. Court took judicial notice of 18CF4803. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Richard L U
Elisha A B
Gwendolyn W-F  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. 24 hr GPS. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Anthony Bernard Butler in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Bernard Butler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
